abstract.p: Yankees notebook; game 1 of ALCS between New York Yankees and Seattle Mariners lasted 3 hours and 45 minutes despite fact that teams combined for only 2 runs and 11 hits (S)

block.p: Seattle and the Yankees combined for only 11 hits and two runs in Game 1 of this series, and somehow the game lasted 3 hours 45 minutes, ending at 11:59 p.m. ''I never thought I'd reach the point where I'd say, 'God, we played a three-hour game, wasn't that great?' '' said Joe Torre, the Yankee manager.

There are two and a half minutes between each half inning because of additional television commercials, a gap so long that Yankees pitcher Denny Neagle would wait a minute or so before going to the mound and beginning his warm-ups. But Torre also mentioned how often pitchers work deep into ball-strike counts.
''Very rarely do you see strike one, strike two, strike three,'' Torre said.
